role: Manager, Data Engineering, Analytics & GenAI Implementation

topMetrics: 175 users supported | 100+ weekly active | 53% daily active

bullets: Leading enterprise analytics + GenAI delivery across 20 countries: United Kingdom, Ireland, Belgium, Luxembourg, Sweden, Austria, Hungary, Canada, Brazil, USA, Australia, New Zealand, Japan, China, France, Netherlands, Italy, Denmark, Poland, Germany
Scale & adoption: 175 users supported, 100+ weekly active users, 53% daily active usage
Delivery footprint: 21 high-impact dashboards, 8 integrated data sources

Operating model (since May 2025): matrix execution with 3 direct / 4 indirect, partnering with Managing Directors, Sales Directors, Regional Sales Managers, and VP Marketing to align roadmap, value cases, rollouts, and adoption across markets
Domain context: Audiological care, with enterprise impact across functions and business units

sections.title: Enterprise BI, KPI Standardization & Executive Reporting

bullets: Drove enterprise BI and analytics transformation across 20 countries/markets, standardizing KPI definitions and executive performance reporting aligned to OKRs for C-suite decision-making
Delivered and governed 21 executive dashboards across Sales, Operations, Marketing, and HR, improving stakeholder alignment and accelerating management cadence through consistent KPI interpretation
Designed and maintained KPI dashboards in Power BI, driving a 2.1% QoQ sales increase and optimizing marketing spend; ensured seamless integration with SAP Analytics Cloud
Increased engagement through dashboard gamification: 60% boost with a target audience of 1,800
Personally liaised with the CEO & Marketing VP of Sonova to develop a board reporting KPI suite
Conducted change management workshops in Berlin, Dortmund, Rotterdam, Brussels, Warsaw, Milan and Paris

Contributed to revenue growth and EBITDA expansion by enabling data-driven commercial decisions: KPI-aligned dashboards directly linked to P&L levers (pricing, mix, volume), enabling leadership to identify margin improvement opportunities
Designed standardized market onboarding pipelines using Databricks + SQL/MS SQL (Azure where relevant) to enable consistent KPIs and reliable cross-country reporting
Automated data collection and reporting pipelines: Reduced FTE time by 75%, Reduced reporting cycle time by 35%, Improved speed and accuracy of operational dashboards
Reduced sales forecasting cycle time by ~30% by improving data pipelines, refresh cadence, and reporting workflows to support faster commercial planning

Designed multi-layer lakehouse pipeline (Medallion architecture) with progressive quality gates: Bronze (raw CDC + file ingestion), Silver (standardized, deduped, conformed), Gold (curated domain marts ‚Äî KPIs, dimensions, ML features) for BI and ML consumption
Established engineering KPI monitoring: MTTR (Mean Time to Recovery) < 30 min, MTTD (Mean Time to Detect) < 15 min for pipeline failures, tracked via automated alerting and incident dashboards

Implemented anomaly detection across pipeline layers: volume anomalies (row count drift), latency anomalies (SLA breaches), schema drift detection, and data distribution shifts using statistical thresholds

subSections.title: Medallion Architecture (Bronze ‚Üí Silver ‚Üí Gold)
bullets: Bronze: Raw CDC streams + file ingestion (JSON, CSV, Parquet) ‚Äî append-only, full history retention
Silver: Standardized schemas, deduplication, data type conformance, business rule validation
Gold: Curated domain marts (KPIs, dimensions, ML feature stores) optimized for BI dashboards and ML pipelines

subSections.title: Engineering KPI Monitoring
bullets: MTTR (Mean Time to Recovery): < 30 min target ‚Äî automated runbooks and incident escalation
MTTD (Mean Time to Detect): < 15 min target ‚Äî real-time alerting on pipeline failures and SLA breaches
Anomaly detection: volume drift, latency spikes, schema changes, data distribution shifts

sections.title: Data Governance, Access Control & Data Quality

bullets: Implemented Databricks governance using Unity Catalog to enforce centralized access controls and scalable cross-domain data sharing, strengthening auditability and data product reliability

Operationalized pipeline reliability by defining SLOs (Service Level Objectives), embedding automated data quality checks (Great Expectations-style) into CI/CD pipelines, and monitoring freshness/schema drift to proactively prevent failures‚Äîcontributing to 30% lower data downtime and 99.9% pipeline reliability
Ensured privacy/regulatory compliance across 20 jurisdictions, aligning with GDPR, local data protection acts, and emerging regulations like the EU AI Act

Designed and operationalized KRI (Key Risk Indicator) tracking and reporting framework: data quality KRIs (freshness, completeness, accuracy), pipeline reliability KRIs (SLO adherence, failure rates), compliance KRIs (access violations, PII exposure attempts)

Implemented anomaly detection at the governance layer using statistical process control and z-score monitoring to flag data quality drift, schema changes, and access pattern anomalies in near-real-time

subSections.title: Key Risk Indicators (KRIs)
bullets: Data Quality KRIs: freshness SLAs, completeness thresholds, accuracy validation scores
Pipeline Reliability KRIs: SLO adherence rates, failure/retry rates, latency percentiles
Compliance KRIs: access violation counts, PII exposure attempts, audit trail completeness
Anomaly Detection: z-score monitoring for data volume drift, schema changes, and access pattern deviations

sections.title: GenAI Delivery, RAG Architecture & AI Governance

bullets: Implemented GenAI apps and chatbots for HR, Operations, and Marketing (requirements ‚Üí build ‚Üí rollout ‚Üí adoption)

Launched GenAI assistants across priority workflows with governance guardrails, improving service enablement outcomes by ~20%: Service ticket deflection, Product recommendations, HR org insights, New-store onboarding
Scaled GenAI apps across company verticals (beyond audiological care): Hearing Instruments, Reliability, R&D, HR

Designed end-to-end RAG pipeline: document ingestion ‚Üí chunking (recursive/semantic) ‚Üí embedding (OpenAI ada-002 / open-source alternatives) ‚Üí vector store (Pinecone/Milvus) ‚Üí retrieval-augmented generation with LangChain orchestration ‚Äî reducing hallucination rates by 90% and grounding outputs in proprietary corporate data
Built FastAPI-based serving layer for GenAI products, enabling low-latency REST endpoints for chatbot inference, analytics queries, and batch processing across HR, Marketing, and Operations use cases

Developed smart analytics products that identify revenue blockers and growth drivers for Sales and Marketing teams, surfacing actionable insights from multi-source data (CRM, ERP, web analytics) to support commercial decision-making

Established an AI Governance Board and implemented guardrails to sanitize inputs/outputs: Prevented PII leakage, Ensured compliance with emerging regulations like the EU AI Act, Enabled safe scaling of GenAI tools to 1,000+ employees across diverse jurisdictions

Delivered a React.js strategic analytics app integrating multiple data sources for: HR (org/team planning, team shuffling, budget management), Marketing (qualified lead insights, store prioritization/targeting), Operations (underperformance monitoring, targeted interventions)

Built AI-powered HR Org Chart product enabling smart organizational decisions: org network analysis (identifying key connectors and bottlenecks), succession planning recommendations, span-of-control optimization, and restructuring impact simulation

Practical applications: automated identification of single-point-of-failure roles, AI-suggested lateral moves for retention-risk employees, budget impact modeling for team restructuring scenarios, and headcount planning aligned to revenue targets
Served via FastAPI backend with React.js frontend, integrating HRIS data, performance metrics, and engagement survey signals for real-time organizational intelligence

subSections.title: HR Org Chart AI Features
bullets: Org network analysis ‚Äî identify key connectors, bottlenecks, and single-point-of-failure roles
Succession planning ‚Äî AI-recommended successors based on skills, performance, and tenure
Span-of-control optimization ‚Äî flag over/under-managed teams with restructuring recommendations
Budget impact modeling ‚Äî simulate headcount changes and forecast cost implications

subSections.title: Operations Features
bullets: Underperformance monitoring

Led a 14 FTE analytics group during Kaizen week and continued managing the team for 4 months afterward
Managed a cross-functional Kaizen team of 14 members across 6 countries
Implemented Agile DataOps methodologies (Scrum/Kanban) and defined distinct technical career ladders: Improved retention by 15%, Increased sprint velocity by 20%
Used Lean Six Sigma, Eisenhower matrix prioritization, and waste reduction techniques: 60% increase in resource productivity, 15% YoY productivity improvement
Deployed workforce optimization models delivering 15% cost reduction while improving operational efficiency
Applied causal/optimization analytics to workforce planning: Improved utilization by ~6%, Improved productivity by ~5%
Built predictive forecasting models (Scikit-learn, XGBoost) for in-store performance: Forecasted staffing needs from historical sales + foot traffic, Optimized labor costs
Sales process optimization: Identified inefficiencies and built Power BI dashboards for daily management, Streamlined operations, increased resource utilization, implemented correct OKRs
Marketing effectiveness: Campaign performance reporting and Marketing ROI assessments, Built a custom actionable model with Sales/Marketing to improve customer journey and optimize marketing budget
Built anomaly detection models for sales and operational metrics, enabling early identification of underperformance and revenue leakage across markets
Developed revenue driver/blocker analysis framework: automated identification of top factors impacting sales conversion, customer retention, and marketing ROI using feature importance and SHAP values

subSections.title: Risk Management
bullets: Developed a strategy with R&D using Porter's 5 forces to navigate the threat of Apple's hearing aid test feature tied to the 2024 AirPods launch
Improved search ads execution and increased first sales appointments in US, CA, EU regions

role: Data Science Associate ‚Äî Customer & Digital Analytics (Retail / Wealth Banking)

bullets: Built customer segmentation and RFM/propensity models to prioritize high-intent cohorts, driving +16% MoM growth in new retirement account acquisitions (Q2'21)
Designed lifecycle segmentation frameworks to classify customers by engagement stage, enabling targeted retention and upsell strategies across Retail and Wealth Banking
Partnered with Marketing and Product teams to translate model outputs into actionable campaign targeting rules, improving conversion rates across digital and branch channels

topMetrics: Robust A/B testing program with incrementality readouts

bullets: Designed a robust A/B testing program (incl. incrementality/uplift readouts) that enabled marketing teams to scale/stop initiatives with confidence and improve marketing ROI / CAC efficiency through better budget allocation
Built statistical frameworks for experiment design including power analysis, sample size calculation, and multi-variant testing to ensure rigorous measurement of campaign effectiveness
Created automated reporting pipelines for experiment results, reducing time-to-insight from weeks to days and enabling faster iteration on marketing strategies

Identified high-impact RMs/wealth advisors for underserved clients and implemented next-best-action style routing/scheduling, improving weekly client interactions by +2.5% and reducing drop-off/abandonment by -8%
Built propensity-to-engage models that scored client-advisor pairings, enabling intelligent matching of high-value clients with the most suitable relationship managers
Developed real-time recommendation engine that surfaced prioritized action items for RMs, including optimal contact timing, preferred channels, and personalized talking points
Analyzed end-to-end digital journeys (readership, video interactions, questionnaire/modules) to pinpoint funnel friction and prioritize content/features that delivered +16% higher engagement
Partnered with engineering to improve page responsiveness and customer experience, reducing load times and improving completion rates across key digital flows
Built funnel visualization dashboards that tracked user progression through multi-step digital processes, enabling product teams to identify and resolve conversion bottlenecks in real-time

Improved email rewards campaign performance during a trading feature launch by using matched-pair A/B testing to isolate incremental impact and reallocate spend, delivering +3.5% more efficient marketing budget utilization (ROI uplift)
Designed matched-pair testing methodology that controlled for confounding variables (account age, AUM, trading frequency), providing statistically rigorous measurement of true campaign lift
Built automated email performance dashboards tracking open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, and incremental revenue attribution across lifecycle stages

topMetrics: BCG-style portfolio view for attrition risk

bullets: Built trader lifecycle models (daily/weekly/monthly active, retained, churned) using a BCG-style portfolio view to flag attrition risk and support proactive retention actions during the GameStop market volatility (2021)
Developed early-warning churn prediction models using behavioral signals (login frequency, trade volume decline, support ticket patterns) to identify at-risk traders before they churned

Created executive dashboards tracking retention cohorts, LTV trajectories, and win-back campaign effectiveness, enabling leadership to make data-driven decisions during periods of extreme market volatility
